review_body: Not very clean considering Japanese cleanliness standards are pretty high and this hotel falls very short of the mark. The carpets are all stained quite badly. We had to ask to change rooms. The second one wasn’t any better. The furnishings are old and dated. There are gaps between the outlets and the wall - unfinished and poorly done. The walls are all marked with luggage skid marks. The bathrooms have mold and a rusted roof access panel. Common areas are ok. But one of the saddest hotels I’ve been to in Tokyo and I’ve been to many. Will never stay here again.

We enjoyed our suite - it was spacious, super clean and was very comfortable. The location was close to Ginza line station so getting around was easy. Staff were very helpful and helped us with planning our day and options for getting around. Thankyou

The room we had was very tired and old. The carpet was light and therefore very stained. The walls were very dirty and bumped . Nothing like the pictures on the website. Lights not working and dressing table mirror stand broken. Not what one would expect from a 5 star boutique hotel

My room was huge, with modern furnishings and was very quiet. The staff was excellent. Located near a subway stop, there are numerous eating and shopping choices in the area. This is a good central location for exploring Tokyo. Only a few subway stops from both Shibuya and Shinjuku, you could walk to both is inclined (it took me twenty minutes to walk to Shibuya Crossing). About a thirty minute subway ride to sites on eastern side of town (Ueno Park and Asakasa Shrine).

This was our first time staying in this hotel. We were not disappointed. We booked two Modern Double Rooms for the five of us. Two adults and two teens and a child. Very spacious. Excellent shower design. We loved it. Nice amenities. Comfortable bed and quiet location. 1 minute walk to the Gaiemae Subway station. It's on the GInza Line and was very convenient. It's a Japanese boutique hotel. We didnt require breakfast, or any facilities in the hotel. We simple needed the room and shower. Concierge Dean Andrew was helpful with restaurant reservations. Taxis didn't know the hotel. Show them the map that comes with the hotel key, and no problems getting to the hotel. Complimentary bottles of water given each day. Housekeeping very attentive. Clean and I like how they observe my preferences. I hate housekeeping that moves everything back to their original spots everyday. Amenities were nice. Level 2 is the main entrance, which is entered from the Stadium street and there is a driveway that you have to turn in and up the ramp to the roundabout of the entrance. Many taxis wouldn't know that entrance. The only complaint I have was , we were on Level 8, and each morning and late at night, I don't know why there are lots of noise thumping, and banging above us. Level 9 is not guest room floor. I am assuming it's from the fitness center and spa that is on level 10. We may return to this hotel in the future if the price is not too expensive.

Not just the bedroom but the bathroom is spacious too. The traditional Japanese breakfast was delicious! If you’re coming on the Ginza line subway with lots of luggage, look for the elevator to the ground level at exit 4a.

I really liked staying here. Big room. Big bed Quiet close to metro nice staff and good breakfast. Spent 6 nights here and booked the same room for our last night 3 weeks later. Not cheap but I think good value for Tokyo. Our room was something like 500 ft.thats big. We were in the 2 nd floor and it was quite. Good hotel layout/location behind the Main Street and room face another building no view but no noise either

The rooms are pretty spacious for Tokyo. Excellent location. I would like congratulate the staff, as the front desk service is really exceptional, really makes a difference in the stay. Will book again. I would recommend additional plugs in the night stands and USB ports to charge electronics.

I had a really enjoyable stay here. This was my first stop on my trip in Japan and I rented a Modern Double Room - it was large and luxurious. The bed was very comfortable and the room was super quiet - the bathroom was spacious, the was shower top notch. Service was extremely polite and obliging. This hotel is located a short walking distance from Meiji Shrine, Shibuya, and Harajuku. Roppongi is about a 40 minute walk away. The nearest train station is only one minute away and it was easy to get to Tokyo Station (~15 mins). Lots of options for food all around....Aoyama is a high end neighborhood and we easily found delicious breakfast, wagyu beef restaurants, and ramen. I would absolutely stay here again if I go back to Tokyo. Thank you Hotel Allamanda for a lovely stay.

I notice that the reviews of this hotel vary widely. We stayed here for 5 nights recently.Our first room was very large as requested ( even by Tokyo standards ) but it was outdated and bathroom was tired. We then realized that there were more recently renovated rooms available and switched to a slightly smaller but updated room. This made a huge difference and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room was still spacious and well planned. No views but this did not matter to us.Service was excellent. Staff went out of their way to help us.Breakfast was good but not cheap. We did not choose the breakfast plan since there was no deal and it gave us options to eat elsewhere.Location is great but one has to realize that Tokyo is so huge, there is no single optimal location.This is a very pleasant area of Tokyo and the subway is steps from the hotel. The hotel is quiet and feels more like a serviced residence than a hotel. Overall a wonderful place to stay. Quiet, well located and wonderful staff

My family spent 8 nights in a Modern Double room at this hotel whilst holidaying in Japan. The rooms are very spacious, and the beds are HUUUGE! There was plenty of room for my husband, 3-year-old daughter and I to sleep. We could have easily fit another child on there. The front desk staff were nice and the cleaning staff were lovely too. I accidentally left a necklace behind in my room, and the cleaning staff found it and reception arranged for it to be posted back to me in Australia for a small fee – thank goodness! The location near Gaienmae subway stop was very handy – only 2 stops to Shibuya, and you could walk there in 30 minutes too. About 15 minutes walk to Harajuku. Only downsides were expensive in-house laundry service, no in-room dining options, and the restaurants on site were quite expensive too. But overall had a very good stay here, and I would return.

First time stay here really like the location. Hotel just next to Tokyo metro and walking distance to Omotesando hills.Big spacious room for Tokyo standard.The only downside for me is I travel with my 5 years old and TV in the room only have CNN and all local channels so nothing for her to do when is raining outside.There’s pool and fitness but kids not allowed ( a lot of city hotel in Japan are like that ).So overall is very nice,staff are very friendly. Just wished they were a little kids and family friendly.

I recently stayed 6 nights at the Allamanda Ayoama and I was very impressed. I was introduced to the hotel by a family friend who is the PR manager of the property, and it didn't take much convincing to give it a try during my last trip to Tokyo. The main reason was the location (I lived for 7 years in Aoyama and to me it's the best area to be in in Tokyo hands down).I'm very glad I tried it. I now have my new go-to-place in Tokyo. Excellent hotel and location. You can't beat staying in the heart of Aoyoama, a couple of minutes walking from Omotesando, 10 minutes to Harajuku through the lovely side streets, and in the heart of everything Aoyama has to offer. And the Ginza line stop is literally outside the hotel. It feels like you are living in a cool neighborhood as a local, not staying a big corporate hotel in a business district. The hotel is feels like it's brand new, the rooms are HUGE for Tokyo standards, and the bathrooms are palatial and really nicely designed. Very well designed and comfortable. The rooms are simple, modern and nothing fancy. Just right. I also loved how quiet the hotel is. It's also not very big so i feels personal. The staff were extremely nice, helpful and most importantly out of your way. It felt like coming "home" every night. The gym is also excellent - as a guest you can access a club that is on the top 2 floors of the building with pools, golf range, classes and every type of machine you could ever imagine. I didn't try the restaurant on premise, as in Tokyo there a endless other options, but it looked very inviting.I'll be definitely going back here next time I go back to Tokyo.
user_name:
FedericoE545
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are absolutely fantastic! The beds are huge, rooms itself is huge, bathroom is amazing! The location of the hotel is great, it’s not far from Shibuya crossing and Shibuya shopping, walking distance away. Water gets filled daily; rooms get cleaned quickly. Staff is very polite. Breakfast is an absolute disaster though, we had it in one morning and we didn’t go again, they do not have a buffet for the breakfast, it is a set Ala carte menu and offers two options, Japanese breakfast or American breakfast, we took the American one, and it tasted horrific , there was nothing tasty on it. Please work on your breakfast! You should also offer more assistance with tours and other recommendations for the tourists. I also used the spa, I went for massage. Now I have few tattoos, they gave me a t shirt and shorts, which I wore and the lady came with a tape and covered up my tattoos, as the spa is members club and there are a lot of older members , so if you have full sleeve tattoos or tattoos which cannot be covered up, this is not your place. I liked the massage, unfortunately I did not use the other facilities in the spa :) Nevertheless, it was a great stay!

Very pleasantly surprised by our stay at Allamanda. The very central location in Kita Aoyama, walking distance from Shibuya and Harajuku/Omotensando/Yoyogi was a key factor in our selection.The hotel itself is spotlessly designed, with large rooms, appointed with state of the art amenities. The hotel also has a first class fitness center, including a swimming pool and Japanese style ofuro/spa.We had an extremely enjoyable stay, notably thanks the dedicated and attentive staff. Check-in time is generally quite late in Tokyo (3-4pm) and the hotel was fully booked upon arrival and unable to accommodate and earlier time. However they immediately gave us access to the spa / fitness center, so we were able to relax and change before going out into the city.

This was our first hotel on our recent trip to Japan. Having been to Japan before (notorious for its tiny rooms) we were blown away by the size of the room. The quality was also great and it's just around the corner of a Metro station of the Ginza line. Perfect for shopping / sightseeing.The staff was excellent - even though I must say that's a given in Japan - and spoke good English. Prices are generally high, but we caught a special offer, making it exceptional value.

The location is good...We are a Cerulean fan however this year we planned our trip quite late so we ran out of vacant hotels in Tokyo. Searching the net was a blessing in disguise i guess because my husband is a bit picky on where we stay (cleanliness, aircon, location, bathroom, etc). Any and every requests we make is accommodated by their front desk team meticulously and sincerely. In totality their people are very accommodating without any qualms or facial expressions that will make you feel that they are tired of helping you out. Even their taxi getter are very nice. This is what i mean by a accommodation to a whole new level. Their hotel is very beautiful, clean and comfortable...thank you for making our vacation comfortable and easy...

It's 11 in the morning, and there is no option to drink a hot coffee in hotel. Swimming pool and spa was extra charge. There were only one open restaurant, first day i could order the plum wine, but for next five days was "sold out", there was no concierge - only ladies from reception, barely speaking english, werent too helpfull. To get an invoice for stay, was mission impossible ;) Hotel had a great location, very near to Ginza line, very nice room and tasty food.

very good location and nice design of the rooms but very poor customer service. it's a 5 stars hotel standards if: you can not get a coffee at 10:00 AM because the cafe is close, you can stay in the hotel bar after 11:00 PM because staff want to close, there is no japanese plum wine (sold out), no concierge, poor english speaking staff at reception and if you need any help able just to print a map from google map. it's a swimming pool but...you have to pay additionally 40 usd every entry...

Room is really great, big, with shower and bath tub, extra large bed, sofa and huge TV. Worth of it. Very clean, nice towels, Location is good, near Metro station of Gaiemmae and in a quiet area, not too much traffic or people (except if there is a game in the stadium nearby).Services didn't met my expectations because to use the SPA must pay over 4000 yens, breakfast is only à la carte (no buffet) and in small quantities (and in my case I asked for tea instead of coffee and they didn't brought the tea... or the coffee) and breakfast costs 2000 yens. I end up using Starbucks in front of the hotel for the breakfast by 1/3 to half of the price...Overall, I recommend this hotel, but forget breakfast and don't go for the SPA...

Located just 20 seconds away from Ginza Line Subway station. Easy access to both Shibuya and Ginza. Hotel has only 40 luxury rooms. If you like a quiet atmosphere, this is it. There are few rooms located on same level as lobby level where 2 consecutive doors with touch key separates lobby and room corridor. It was only 10 seconds walk from my room to reception. NICE. I definitely come back if I have a chance to visit Tokyo as a business trip. Hotel opened few month ago. Hotel entrance near subway station is still under construction.

駅からから近くてとても便利でした。ホテルの周りはショッピングする場所も多くて、立地は大満足でした。ホテルの廊下もお部屋も広くて、ビューがよかったです。家具も可愛くて快適に過ごせました。次はフィットネスも使ってみたいです。Easy to access! It is one minite walk from Gaien mae station. There is a lot of shopping place aroud hotel. About a room, stadium view is soooooo nice and they have lovely furniture too.

I recently visited Tokyo and selected this hotel from a very popular hotel "Booking" website and paid extra specifically for the reason they have a gym and a bigger room, which is rare in Tokyo. When we got there, they said that the gym was exclusive for hotel guests, but they 4000JPY per person per session!!!! This is ridiculous. Not a good start. On top of that, the beds were really uncomfortable (i don't mean because they're Japanese and hard, i've been to Tokyo many times, and this was the worst i've ever experienced), it was hot in Tokyo at this time and the air-con barely worked so the room never got below 26deg C - we complained and they apologised and said there was nothing they could do, and we even saw a cockroach on the floor in the entrance lobby. I only give it a 2 because the staff were courteous, polite, and friendly, and accepted our complaints with apologies. I love Japan and Tokyo, and i love every trip there, but i would highly suggest to anyone to find a nice cheap hotel with a small room in a good location, forget the gym, walk lots instead, and try not to eat too much of the beautiful food on offer around the city.
